title: Case-Based Integrated Science-Mathematics Concept Teaching Method Design for Visually Impaired Students

context.prior_knowledge: Secondary science education theory, teaching experience with visually impaired students, scientific experiment design methods, and understanding of basic mathematical concepts (measurement, graphs, statistics)
context.additional_context: Conducted in offline classrooms using digital devices (tablets, braille displays, text-to-speech software). Focuses on developing pedagogical methods to enhance science concept understanding for visually impaired students, including concept reinforcement via mathematical analysis tools (measurement, data visualization).

learning_goals: Learners develop three or more case study-based lesson plans promoting scientific process skills (observation, classification, reasoning) and mathematical analysis (measurement, graph interpretation, data pattern recognition) for visually impaired students, creating instructional materials meeting four or more of five expert-reviewed criteria (accessibility, interactivity, assessment system)
Develop science concept and mathematical modeling (equations, statistics) educational materials utilizing multisensory approaches (tactile, auditory, kinesthetic)
Apply collaborative learning strategies addressing visually impaired studentsâ€™ needs in large classrooms and establish peer feedback systems during mathematical problem-solving processes
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
